oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena

Class OracleQueryProgressMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena.OracleQueryProgressMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class OracleQueryProgressMonitor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class implements logic to manage query executions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void addQuery(java.sql.Connection conn, long queryID, java.sql.Time ts)
      This method adds to the query management table an entry using the given queryID and timestamp.
      static void deleteAllQueries(java.sql.Connection conn)
      This method deletes all entries from the query management table.
      static void deleteQuery(java.sql.Connection conn, long queryID)
      This method deletes from the query management table an entry using the given queryID.
      void deregisterAndCloseStatement(java.lang.String szQueryID, java.sql.ResultSet rs)
      This method will find the statement that opens this result set, deregister the mapping between the provided query ID and the statment found, close the result set, and the statement.
      void deregisterAndCloseStatement(java.lang.String szQueryID, java.sql.Statement stmt)
      This method will find the statement that opens this result set, deregister the mapping between the provided query ID and the statment found, close the result set, and the statement.
      static OracleQueryProgressMonitor getInstance()
      Returns an instance of OracleQueryProgressMonitor
      static void initTable(java.sql.Connection conn)
      This method creates a query management table under the current schema and an index on the table for fast lookups.
      static void listQueries(java.sql.Connection conn, java.util.List<java.lang.Long> listQueryIDs, java.util.List<java.sql.Time> listTS)
      This method reads from the query management table and returns a list of query IDs and their corresponding creation time in the two given List objects.
      void run()
      This method performs periodic checks to see if there is query management task to be performed.
      void startMonitor()
      This method starts the monitor thread.
      void stopMonitor()
      This method stops the monitor thread

    • Method Detail

      • addQuery

        public static void addQuery(java.sql.Connection conn,
                            long queryID,
                            java.sql.Time ts)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method adds to the query management table an entry using the given queryID and timestamp. Note that this transaction will not be committed. An explicit commit call is required to persist the change.
        Parameters:
        conn - an Oracle Database connection
        queryID - query identifier
        ts - creation time
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • deleteAllQueries

        public static void deleteAllQueries(java.sql.Connection conn)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method deletes all entries from the query management table. Note that this transaction will not be committed. An explicit commit call is required to persist the change.
        Parameters:
        conn - an Oracle Database connection
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • deleteQuery

        public static void deleteQuery(java.sql.Connection conn,
                               long queryID)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method deletes from the query management table an entry using the given queryID. Note that this transaction will not be committed. An explicit commit call is required to persist the change.
        Parameters:
        conn - an Oracle Database connection
        queryID - query identifier
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • deregisterAndCloseStatement

        public void deregisterAndCloseStatement(java.lang.String szQueryID,
                                        java.sql.ResultSet rs)
        This method will find the statement that opens this result set, deregister the mapping between the provided query ID and the statment found, close the result set, and the statement.

      • deregisterAndCloseStatement

        public void deregisterAndCloseStatement(java.lang.String szQueryID,
                                        java.sql.Statement stmt)
        This method will find the statement that opens this result set, deregister the mapping between the provided query ID and the statment found, close the result set, and the statement.

      • getInstance

        public static OracleQueryProgressMonitor getInstance()
        Returns an instance of OracleQueryProgressMonitor

      • initTable

        public static void initTable(java.sql.Connection conn)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method creates a query management table under the current schema and an index on the table for fast lookups.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • listQueries

        public static void listQueries(java.sql.Connection conn,
                               java.util.List<java.lang.Long> listQueryIDs,
                               java.util.List<java.sql.Time> listTS)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method reads from the query management table and returns a list of query IDs and their corresponding creation time in the two given List objects.
        Parameters:
        conn - an instance of Oracle Database connection. The assumption here is that the relational table for query management has already been created.
        listQueryIDs - a List of long values to store the fetched query IDs.
        listTS - a List of Time objects to store the fetched creation time.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • run

        public void run()
        This method performs periodic checks to see if there is query management task to be performed.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • startMonitor

        public void startMonitor()
        This method starts the monitor thread. Normally we do not want start this monitor except in Joseki setup.

      • stopMonitor

        public void stopMonitor()
        This method stops the monitor thread
